# Survive the night


**Drop Dead: The Cabin** is a co-op VR survival horror game where you must survive the hordes of the living dead. Become a survivor in a forest full of thrills, chills and kills.

{1210997950116932}

**Co-op Survival Action**

Partner up with a friend for an intense battle, where teamwork is crucial for survival.

{877805244304818}

**Immersive Combat**

Wield weapons of mass destruction. Use a raygun or a machete. It’s up to you.

**Customisation**

New weapon skin packs are available. Every purchase supports the continued development of The Cabin.

{3791428691185459}

**Zombie Hordes**

Face the oncoming hordes of zombies that will keep you on your toes as they become more fearsome over time. 

**Unique Zombies**

Battle an array of deadly zombie types, each more unpredictable than the last, keeping every encounter fresh and intense!

{1254520162341881}

**Home Invasion**

Defend your real home from the horde in this award winning mixed-reality experience.

{884402176566479}

**Key Features:**
- Explore the forest 
- Unlock upgrades and achievements 
- Interactive objects
- Huge arsenal of weapons 
- Weapon customisation

changelog.change_log:
Update 3.0.0:

New Weapons:

Raygun: Powerful, futuristic weapon with high damage. Hard to obtain but worth it.
Grenade: First explosive weapon. Available in special crates, damages both zombies and players.
Machete: High-durability melee weapon, perfect for hacking through the undead.
Sniper Rifle: Long-range bolt action rifle with a customisable scope, great for co-op support.

Private Lobbies & Join in Progress: 

Host private sessions with friends, now featuring "Join in Progress" based on community feedback.

Inventory System & Ammo:

Sniper shares ammo pool with hunting rifle.
Raygun has its own ammo pool and indicator.

New Skin Packs:

Two new purchasable weapon skin packs with a Skin-Changing System.

Known Issues:

Grenade fuse resets if picked up after arming.
Machete kills don’t count for specific achievements.
Grenade kills don’t display or count towards kill achievements.
Raygun hand-swapping can be jerky.
Hand grenade ring slightly offset from the pin.

Changes in 2.2.2:

Shotgun Improvements
- Increased range, damage, ammo per box and ammo capacity.
- Enhanced viability for mayhem and destruction.

Beginner Mode Adjustments
- Fuel cells are now more beginner-friendly with a fixed placement.

Ammo Distribution
- Increased availability of Rifle Ammo.
- Increased availability of Shotgun Ammo.

Known Issues:
- Texture on shotgun ammo box still says 6 rounds instead of 12
- Home invasion weapon spawn is causing items to drop through the floor
-- We are already looking at a hotfix for the items dropping through the floor and hope to provide that solution soon

Changes in 2.2.1:

- Players on Beginner mode will get an additional 15 RP to start with to grant easier and quicker means to exit the initial Cabin area
- Players in Beginner mode have a health increase from 100 to 120
- Leeches have been disabled on Beginner mode
- Leech look time has been increased across all difficulties
- Leech shake time has been reduced across all difficulties
- Leech spawner health has been reduced across all difficulties
- Leech jump wait time has been increased across all difficulties

Known Issues:

- Weapons falling to the floor or spawning incorrectly when a meta table is defined in the play area. We are currently working on a fix.

Changes in 2.2.0:

- Added support for a Boundaryless guardian in Home Invasion (MR MODE)
- The hard requirement of a table in the Home Invasion (MR MODE) room setup is now optional
- Added a new 'Room Editor' function allowing you to move and place the console and weapon rack anywhere in your room in Home Invasion (MR MODE)
- We have revised Home Invasion (MR MODE) room instructions to be less confusing

Known issues:

- Super large play spaces with Boundaryless support may result in odd gameplay behaviour such as grass, tress and other objects appearing in the mapped space. We are looking at solution to resolve this longer term.
- Fixed an issue where the forest floor (grass) would unintentionally appear in your real life room in Home Invasion mode.

Cabin 2.1.0

What's new?

- Brand new 'Leecher' enemy in Home Invasion (MR Mode)
- New difficulty modes in Home Invasion (MR Mode)
- Improved onboarding and window scaling in Home Invasion (MR Mode)
- Festive mode enabled from the 14th of December to 5th of January 2024
- Bugs, fixes and improvements
Improved Home Invasion onboarding and room setup flow.
Added news panel in Home Invasion Mixed Reality mode

- Brand new Mixed Reality mode - Home Invasion!
- Added further visual enhancements to the Quest 3 version

Cabin Quest 3 Update is here:

- Quest 3 Visual and performance improvements
- NEW Beginner mode
- NEW Arcade reload option (Drop Dead: Dual Strike inspired), pouch reload and manual reload options available too
- NEW Teleport movement option

Plus lots of additional bug fixes and improvements

Home Invasion (Mixed Reality) mode launching 25th of October 2023!

Patch 1.1.2
- Fixed a major crash issue
- A whole host of minor improvements; tweaks and bug fixes

Introducing brand new sky box variations and fog effects across the new difficulty modes for enhanced visual immersion.
Fine-tuning of 'normal mode' to provide a more accessible and enjoyable experience for all players.
Resolved a critical bug preventing the triggering of the 'Kill All' objective in the Mine Pit, ensuring smooth gameplay progression.
Successfully rectified an imbalance where the 'client' player would endure excessive damage compared to the 'Host,' preventing unfair one-shot situations.
Rifle ammo distribution - You can now acquire rifle ammunition from the random and 'special ammo'  crates.

Issues fixed in 1.0.4

Known Improvements:

- Improved melee hit responsiveness
- Modified lobby options - ‘Quick Play’ and a new ‘Host Friends’ option to avoid random players joining lobbies intended to be closed
- Re-worked Item grab and visualisation for an improved item pick-up accuracy
- Improvements to melee throwing mechanics, including velocity, item travel, and item embed.
- Melee audio revamped to feel more satisfying
- Added a dot over an item when hovered to indicate where to grasp the item.

Known Fixes:
- Fixed an issue where player cosmetics such as golden revolver and laser sight weren't visible to another player.
- Fixed an issue where players' extraction time was logging incorrectly on the leaderboards
- Fixed an issue where changing Belt depth past a certain point caused the ammo pouch to lose UI
- Fixed an exploit where players could stand at the extraction door to outpace zombie spawns
- Fixed an issue where extraction can fail to trigger
- Fixed an issue where occasionally weapons could occupy both back holsters
- Rebalanced Meta Game

We are continuing to investigate and fix performance related stutters and crashes.
- Fixed a critical bug required to run v50 Meta Quest Firmware
